Description:
Standard Wall-Mounted BioWall Controller (Model 3048)

The Standard Wall-Mounted BioWall Controller is housed in a gray, powder-coated steel cabinet, designed to be bolted or screwed to stud-backed wall, plywood faced wall, or masonry wall, such as the wall of mechanical room.

Clearances:

  • See required clearances (in yellow) in drawings above.
  • Maintain at least 36 inches standing/kneeling space outside cabinet door.
  • Allow at least 8 inches clearance left, right, and above cabinet.

Siting and Mounting:

  • Up to 70 feet below the BioWall irrigation header
  • Consult Furbish regarding allowable project-specific horizontal distances between controller and vegetated panels.
  • Bolt cabinet to wall.

Sizing:

  • Up to two (2) irrigation zones in open-loop configuration or one (1) zone in closed-loop configuration (very few BioWalls have more than one zone)
  • 2.5 gallon nutrient reservoir, capable to fertilizing a 500 SF BioWall with 1 month between nutrient refills.

Backflow Prevention:

  • To be provided by others; usually required by plumbing code.
  • May be located next to, above, or below cabinet (not inside cabinet) as long as backflow preventer does not encroach upon controller's clearances, and as long as backflow preventer's drainage connection is shielded from controller's electronics.
  • May be sited anywhere upstream of controller.

Climate Control:

  • Maintain above 50 degrees F.

Floor-Mounted BioWall Controller (Model 4872)

The Floor-Mounted BioWall Controller is housed in a heavy-duty, gray, powder-coated steel cabinet, designed to be mounted to a floor, such as the floor of a mechanical room or parking garage.

Clearances:

  • See required clearances (in yellow) in drawings above.
  • Maintain at least 36 inches standing/kneeling space outside cabinet door.
  • Allow at least 8 inches clearance left, right, and above cabinet.

Siting and Mounting:

  • Up to 70 feet below the BioWall irrigation header
  • Consult Furbish regarding allowable project-specific horizontal distances between controller and vegetated panels.
  • Bolt cabinet to floor.

Sizing:

  • Up to four (4) irrigation zones in open-loop configuration or one (1) zone in closed-loop configuration (very few BioWalls have more than one zone)
  • 5 gallon nutrient reservoir, capable to fertilizing a 1,000 SF BioWall with 1 month between nutrient refills.

Backflow Prevention:

  • To be provided by others; usually required by plumbing code.
  • May be located next to, above, or below cabinet (not inside cabinet) as long as backflow preventer does not encroach upon controller's clearances, and as long as backflow preventer's drainage connection is shielded from controller's electronics.
  • May be sited anywhere upstream of controller.

Climate Control:

  • Maintain above 50 degrees F.

Closet-Mounted BioWall Controller (Model 2460)

The Closet-Mounted BioWall Controller is designed to fit snugly within a 24-inch x 18-inch closet. Closet-Mounted Controller is delivered to the jobsite on a panel that is designed to be bolted or screwed to stud-backed wall, plywood faced wall, or masonry wall.

Clearances:

  • See required clearances (in yellow) in drawings above.
  • Maintain at least 36 inches standing/kneeling space outside cabinet door.

Siting and Mounting:

  • Up to 70 feet below the BioWall irrigation header
  • Consult Furbish regarding allowable project-specific horizontal distances between controller and vegetated panels.
  • Screw panel to wall.

Sizing:

  • One (1) irrigation zone (very few BioWalls have more than one zone)
  • 5 gallon nutrient reservoir, capable to fertilizing a 1,000 SF BioWall with 1 month between nutrient refills.

Backflow Prevention:

  • To be provided by others; usually required by plumbing code.
  • May be located next to, above, or below cabinet (not inside cabinet) as long as backflow preventer does not encroach upon controller's clearances, and as long as backflow preventer's drainage connection is shielded from controller's electronics.
  • May be sited anywhere upstream of controller.

Climate Control:

  • Maintain above 50 degrees F.

Base-Cabinet BioWall Controller (Model 3527)

The Base-Cabinet BioWall Controller is designed to housed in a standard 36-inch width base cabinet, and is delivered to the jobsite on a panel that is designed to be screwed to the back of cabinet interior.

Clearances:

  • See required clearances (in yellow) in drawings above.
  • Maintain at least 36 inches standing/kneeling space outside cabinet door.

Siting and Mounting:

  • Up to 70 feet below the BioWall irrigation header
  • Consult Furbish regarding allowable project-specific horizontal distances between controller and vegetated panels.
  • Screw panel to back of cabinet interior.

Sizing:

  • One (1) irrigation zone (very few BioWalls have more than one zone)
  • 2.5 gallon nutrient reservoir, capable to fertilizing a 500 SF BioWall with 1 month between nutrient refills.

Backflow Prevention:

  • To be provided by others; usually required by plumbing code.
  • Must be located outside of base cabinet.
  • May be sited anywhere upstream of controller.

Climate Control:

  • Maintain above 50 degrees F.

When installing the base-cabinet controller, the base cabinet face must be removed, as shown above left. Controller requires full height of base cabinet, so utilize either a false drawer front or full-height doors. After controller installation, cabinet face may be installed (above right). Cabinet doors without center stiles are preferred.
